data.text: @hammerfeather @helenczerski I have been wondering the same thing, if airborne transmission is the cause of the majority of infections, are we really more protected by avoiding handshakes? I always thought the elbow bump brought you closer so was more risky (especially now most cough into their elbow).
@helenczerski I still wear a mask in indoor spaces. I like to give people a smile when interacting, I still do it even though they can’t see I’m smiling, I miss that.
@helenczerski Hopefully it will come back Helen - team members all shook hands after the quiz last night!
@helenczerski I had a kitten named "Mitten". She loved nothing more than chewing up my shuttlecocks. I would catch her and yell at her "bad Mitten!"
@helenczerski Often it's the insignificant things that make a big impact. I'm sorry Helen.

@helenczerski To what extent is airborne COVID transmitted by touch?

Does hand gel do far more to prevent gastrointestinal illnesses than COVID?

@helenczerski I play petanque and when distancing came in we started bumping elbows.  After a while it switched to mainly fist bumps. Now it's a weird rock-paper attempt to choose handshake or fist bump to match your opponents!
@helenczerski You could give a mutual pat on each other's bums and head-tops with those badminton rackets  ??  🙂
